item.description:
Brattle description:
Kurt Vonnegut's mind-bending novel is brought to vibrant, phantasmagoric life on screen in this '70s classic. {Billy} Pilgrim survives the firebombing of Dresden only to find himself living simultaneously in his own past, 'present', and future. Though definitively a product of the 1970s, SLAUGHTERHOUSE-FIVE remains a remarkable examination of war, loneliness, life, humanity, and the intersection of personal and world history.

Howard Zinn will be introducing the film. (At 6:00 pm on the same night as the movie, Zinn and Jimmy Tingle will be discussing Zinn's new book, "A Young People's History of the United States." If you want to go, get your tickets ASAP.)
item.how_to_find_us: Because this movie ends so late, no time for discussion or discuss online.
item.name: Last minute "Slaughterhouse Five"
